intro: Cacalia hastata subsp. lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in late spring to early summer. The subspecies lancifolia is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to other subspecies of Cacalia hastata.
